Class Cell

java.lang.Object
Cell
public class Cell extends Object
Class representing a cell in the game grid. Each cell can contain various elements such as ships, grenades, and indicators for called positions.
Author:
Darshansinh Dilipsinh Devda (40261713), Pranaykumar Chauhan Rajeshkumar (40266722)

COMP6481 Assignment 1 Due Date : 16 Feb 2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell()
      Constructor to initialize a cell with default values. By default, all elements are absent and the cell is not called.

  • Method Details

    • hasHumanShip

      public boolean hasHumanShip()
      Check if a human player's ship is present in the cell.
      Returns:
      True if a human player's ship is present, false otherwise.

    • hasHumanGrenade

      Check if a human player's grenade is present in the cell.
      Returns:
      True if a human player's grenade is present, false otherwise.

      Check if a computer player's ship is present in the cell.
      Returns:
      True if a computer player's ship is present, false otherwise.

      Check if a computer player's grenade is present in the cell.
      Returns:
      True if a computer player's grenade is present, false otherwise.

    • hasCalled

      public boolean hasCalled()
      Check if the cell has been called.
      Returns:
      True if the cell has been called, false otherwise.

    • markHumanShip

      public void markHumanShip()
      Mark the presence of a human player's ship in the cell.

    • markCall

      public void markCall()
      Mark the cell as called.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Override toString method to represent the cell's contents as a string. Returns a string representing the contents of the cell based on the presence of different elements. 's' for human player's ship, 'S' for computer player's ship, 'g' for human player's grenade, 'G' for computer player's grenade, 'x' for called position, '_' for empty position.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String representation of the cell's contents.
